newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Chairman mulls sale of Prod-Art stake.
newsitem.headline: Chairman mulls sale of Prod-Art stake.

text.p: Consumer electronic products maker Prod-Art Technology (Holdings) Ltd said on Tuesday its chairman Chan Suk Ping was in talks to sell his stake in the company to independent third parties.
The company said Chan "is still having discussions with various parties regarding the sale of his shareholding in the company, and no formal or informal agreement or understanding has been reached."
Chan holds 35.5 percent of Prod-Art Technology.

Prod-Art Technology said any purchase of Chan's entire shareholding in the company would result in a change of control of the company and the purchaser would be obliged to make a general offer for the company shares.
The company said Chan "has not made any decision as to whether or not he will dispose of part or all of his shares".
The company's shares, which gained HK$0.075 or 22 percent on Monday, were unchanged at HK$0.415 each in early morning trade.
